location.activity-description: Enhanced Capacity of Government of Iraq to address TB and HIV/AIDS

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Number of new smear positive cases reported to National Health Authority per year per 100,000 population 2. Treatment success rate: New smear-positive TB patients cured plus completed treatment among the new smear positiveTB patients registered during a specified period (percentage) 3. Number of laboratory technicians trained on DOTS

baseline.comment:
1.a 3,347 1 new smear positive TB cases are detected .b (11/100k. Pop)
2. 85%
3. 560

target.comment: 1) 3465 new smear positive TB cases. 2) 2,992 new smear positive TB cases successfully complete their treatment. 3)15 TB culture laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance.

actual.comment: 1) 2561 new smear positive TB cases are detected. 2) 2393/2738 (87%) new smear positive TB cases successfully completed their treatment. 3) 12 TB culture laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance.

target.comment: 1) 2715 new smear positive TB cases are detected. 2) 2310 new smear positive TB cases successfully complete their treatment. 3) 15 TB culture laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance.

actual.comment: 1) by End of June 2015 1476 new smear positive TB cases are detected. 2) by End of June 2015 (1211/1361 89%) new smear positive TB cases successfully completed their treatment. 3) 15 TB culture laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1.3.1 % of trainees passing the individual skills evaluation disaggregated by gender 1.3.2 % of trainees satisfied with the quality of training in terms relevance and usefulness 1.4.1 List of EDP equipment procured and installed 1.4.2 # of plans developed by the users of equipment.

3.1.1 # of reports prepared on energy efficient housing 3.1.2 Conference on energy efficient housing is held 3.1.3 %of Iraqi governorates participating in the conference

baseline.comment: No Multi-purpose Hall Building in the KA Community

target.comment: Construct the Multi-purpose Hall has initiated. A participatory process undertaken to determine the use and management of the Multi-purpose Hall

actual.comment:
The contractor (Dalo Group Companies) completed excavations, cast foundation concrete, built under DPC, cast DPC, built 50% of the parameter fence, and built the generator room.
Based on the baseline needs assessment survey and consultation with community members, the priority needs for activities to be conducted in the Multi-purpose Hall were identified.
While the Multi-purpose Hall will be constructed, Kurani Ainkawa Multi-Purpose Centre (KAMPC) has already started conducting various community activities as highlighted below, based on the needs addressed by the community members. These activities have helped to build the community’s trust in the project and support to build team spirit in the community. This will increase the community’s participation in constructing the Multi-Purpose Hall, which will build community ownership.

target.comment: Multi-Purpose Hall with a focus on women and youth in Kurani Ainkawa constructed in Q2, demonstrating environmentally friendly design features, operated by trained community residents.

actual.comment: Construction of the Multi-purpose Hall Building in the KA Community completed in Q3 due to some delays.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. # of Projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanisms. 2. Divergence between planned and actual disbursement. 3. Number of line ministries officials trained on fiduciary monitoring. 4. # of days needed to complete a transparent procurement process. 5. % of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time.

baseline.comment: 1. No project has embedded fiduciary monitoring mechanisms. 2. More than 20% divergence between the planned and actual disbursement. 3. Low national capacity to undertake fiduciary monitoring. 4. More than 210 days. 5. 50%.

target.comment: 1. 19 projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanism, 1) # of days needed to complete a transparent procurement process (i) Bid evaluation 90 days, (ii) contract negotiation 60 days, 2) 90% of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time. 2. 19 projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanism, 1) Divergence between planned and actual disbursement of less than 20%, 2) # of days needed to complete a transparent financial management process / LC issuance of 60 days, 3) 90% of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time. 3. 1) Establishing an annual capacity building plan for PMTs. 2) 150 Iraqi official in charge of ODA loan projects trained(including 30 % of female officials)

actual.comment: 1. 1) i, ii: N.A for security situation 2) Achieved 2. 1) Not Achieved for security situation 2) Achieved 3) Achieved 3. 1) Achieved 2) Achieved

target.comment: 1. 23 projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanism, # of days needed to complete a transparent procurement process (Bid evaluation 90 days, contract negotiation 60 days), 90% of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time. 2. 23 projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanism, Divergence between planned and actual disbursement of less than 20%, # of days needed to complete a transparent financial management process / LC issuance of 60 days, 90% of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time. 3. Establishing an annual capacity building plan for PMTs. 150 Iraqi official in charge of ODA loan projects trained(including 30 % of female officials)

iati-activity.title: Support to Security Sector Reform: Phase II
iati-activity.description: SSR Phase II will support the GoI in three main ways: 1- To implement the NSS as it relates to SSR 2- Strengthen democratic oversight of the security sector 3- Enhance civil engagement with the security sector

document-link.title: Support to Security Sector Reform: Phase II

iati-activity.title: SSR Phase II
iati-activity.description: Output 1: The GoI Plan for Security Sector Reform is developed. Output 2: The democratic oversight capacity of the SDC is strengthened. Output 3. GoI engagement with civil society in the field of SSR is increased.

iati-activity.title: Funding Facility for stabilization
iati-activity.description: to quickly respond to emerging needs of the areas which were under ISIL control, this project is an addition to the LADP that supports the short and medium term stabilization and early recovery requirements within the longer term Local Area Development.
iati-activity.participating-org: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)

iati-activity.title: Fund Facilityfor stabilization
iati-activity.description: Iraqi Government is supported to address the immediate stabilization and recovery needs in newly accessible areas which allows for the sustainable return of IDPs

baseline.comment: Iraqi Government took control of previously ISIL controlled areas and has started some initial urgent repairs of infrastructure mainly water and electricity

target.comment: 80% of agreed upon priority stabilization and early recovery initiatives by local authorities have been implemented within 6 months
